Evidence: 1) Off‑black text on an off‑white background reads softer than pure #000/#fff. 2) Meta text and outlines use a cool grey, consistent across dates and pill buttons. 3) A single accent (warm amber) appears on the email link; CTAs rely on neutral outlines rather than competing hues, keeping the page cohesive. Limitation: Accent strategy is under‑demonstrated (only one colored link; no visible hover/state logic), so the system feels conservative rather than notably refined.

typography.explanation: Hierarchy is clear and restrained: a bold sans hero (~3 lines, comfortable ~45–60ch measure) followed by consistent card titles and small grey meta lines. Labels like 'Selected Works' and 'Past Projects' repeat a lighter micro‑style and spacing, indicating a scale system. No default blue links; nav items use a muted grey and the nameplate in small caps at top‑left is controlled. Rags are tidy and there are no widows/orphans. Limitation: Typeface choice and voice feel generic (likely a common system sans) and link/hover state styling is not evident, so the typographic system lacks a distinctive signature.

layout_composition.explanation: Consistent grid and rhythm across multiple sections: left‑text/right‑portrait hero aligns with the left edge of the project grid; generous white space creates a calm scan. Project tiles form disciplined two‑column rows with identical gutters, matched corner radii (~16–20px), and even vertical rhythm between rows. Section headings are aligned and a subtle divider separates sections, reinforcing structure. Limitation: The overall structure is conventional (standard hero + uniform grid) and the bottom‑right scroll‑to‑top control floats slightly off the grid, reducing cohesion.

color.explanation: Neutrals are tuned (off‑white background, off‑black text, soft grey meta) and feel comfortable. Pastel tile mats (light blue, mint, blush) are low‑saturation and harmonize varied thumbnails while keeping the shell quiet; the black‑and‑white portrait avoids extra noise. Accent use is restrained and consistent with the subdued palette. Limitation: Interaction/primary accent color isn’t clearly defined and the differing pastel mats introduce slight value flicker across tiles.

typography.explanation: Readable sans system with clear scale steps: a very large H1 ('Hi, I’m Rajat') with tight but non‑colliding leading; body paragraph under the hero sits around a 60–70ch measure with ~1.5 leading; left column project list shows hierarchy via bold red for the active item and pale gray for inactive items. Apostrophes/quotes appear correct and casing is mostly consistent. Limitations: link treatment for the small 'NDA Protected' labels looks defaultish red with little styling and crowds the caption; the struck‑through 'Skilled in User Research' line reduces clarity; oversized 'Let’s Connect' headline creates a jumpy type scale and overwhelms nearby content.

layout_composition.explanation: Basic two‑column structure for 'Featured Projects' is clear: left menu of project names and a right preview tile with matched corner radius and a caption aligned beneath. Sections are distinct (hero, projects, canvas, contact), and alignment is generally left‑anchored. The 'Creative Canvas' box uses a consistent rounded container and grid texture. Limitations: large areas of empty space create imbalance between the tall left list and single preview; the 'Creative Canvas' container feels under‑filled with decorative elements floating; the oversized red 'Let’s Connect' panel dominates and the center divider/email/button grouping feels loosely tied to the grid.

color.explanation: Consistent red/orange accent applied across name, active project, canvas border, and contact section; black/white neutrals keep content readable; imagery introduces purple/blue without direct clashes. Buttons in the red footer contrast well. Limitations: neutrals read as near‑pure #000/#fff rather than tuned greys; the saturated red footer is visually heavy relative to prior sections; no evident unifying mats/shadows to harmonize mixed project imagery, and the speckled hero background adds slight noise.

typography.explanation: Refined serif-led system with clear hierarchy: a medium-weight headline contrasted with lighter body copy; post titles heavier with smaller grey meta lines beneath. Comfortable measures (~60–70ch) and generous 1.5–1.6 leading produce an even reading rhythm. Links are customized (muted hue plus small » caret, no default blue) and appear consistent across sections. Spacing between list items is uniform, and casing stays in sentence case throughout. Limitation: several meta lines and small labels are very light against the warm background, and interactive states (hover/visited) are not evident.

layout_composition.explanation: A disciplined single-column grid with ample negative space; the hero text block and the posts card share the same left edge for strong alignment. The posts module is cohesive—rounded corners, subtle 1px border and inner shadow, identical item spacing, and tidy pagination controls. A left icon rail provides a distinctive but restrained secondary navigation element without breaking the grid. Subscribe field and footer elements snap to the main column width, preserving rhythm. Limitation: overall structure is simple with limited complexity or image handling to stress-test the system; the icon rail feels slightly small/ambiguous.

color.explanation: Warm, tuned neutrals throughout: parchment-like off-white background, soft beige panels, and tinted shadows/borders avoid harsh #000/#fff. Text sits in a dark warm grey/brown, while links use a desaturated accent and tiny caret—accents are sparse and controlled. The posts card uses a slightly darker value to separate from the background without loud contrast. Limitation: some small grey copy risks low contrast, and the near-monochrome palette can feel a touch flat without stronger state cues.

typography.explanation: Readable sans system with clear weight contrast; hero headline uses strong bold phrases with secondary body copy at a comfortable measure (~60–70ch) and ample leading. Repeated yellow 'marker' emphasis gives a distinct voice and is applied consistently in hero and section headers. Links in body appear customized (teal vs default blue) and buttons use a small arrow with matching text weight. However, hierarchy leans on many inline bold phrases in the hero, producing a slightly busy first block; testimonial cards show tight name/role spacing; and the overall voice feels template‑like with 'Hi, I’m …' pattern. Template scent caps at 3.

layout_composition.explanation: Sections stack cleanly with consistent gutters and generous negative space; project tiles share unified rounded cards and bottom‑left CTA placement; testimonial cards form a disciplined two‑column grid with matching radii/shadows. Hero maintains left alignment and balanced margins; device renders sit on soft mats. Weaknesses: angled device renders reduce on‑tile readability; one project card uses a large fade/overlay that interrupts rhythm; the logos band shows mixed logo sizes introducing visual wobble. Strong but largely conventional and template‑like, so capped at 3.

color.explanation: Tuned neutrals: off‑white paper texture, soft greys, and a warm light‑yellow section create a cohesive shell. Accent strategy is controlled—saturated yellow highlighter + small teal links/buttons—repeated in headers and CTAs. Device mock backgrounds are muted so UI color doesn’t clash. Minor issues: brand logos introduce multiple unrelated hues in the logo strip; the star/doodle accent and strong yellow highlight can feel a touch hot against the otherwise soft palette.

typography.explanation: Basic, readable sans in the nameplate and nav; casing mixes (all‑caps name vs. sentence‑case nav) provide minimal hierarchy. No visible custom link styling or state logic in the header—links appear as plain text. There’s no visible type scale beyond the header; project tiles lack captions, so hierarchy relies on image size rather than type. Overall legible but generic and under‑specified. Limitation: absence of a clear typographic system (headings, captions, meta) makes the page feel more like a collage than a designed editorial experience.

layout_composition.explanation: The homepage is a masonry‑like collage with inconsistent tile sizes and irregular vertical bottoms; large dark tile (top‑left) visually outweighs neighboring light tile without compensating grid logic. Mixed device presentations (iMac mock with white mat, tilted iPad/iPhone with heavy drop shadow, straight phone frames, full‑bleed photography) create rhythm flicker and break cohesion. Gutters vary perceptibly and some images feel flush to edges while others float with shadows, suggesting inconsistent spacing logic. Limitation: lack of unified mats/radii/caption positions prevents a stable scan pattern.

color.explanation: Shell is stark black/white with no defined accent; color is driven entirely by tiles. Strong value and hue jumps (dark charcoal hero, saturated orange UI, magenta chat bubbles, bright yellow screens, vivid blue architectural photo) create visual noise. No unifying tactics like consistent mats, border tints, or toned shadows to harmonize imagery, so the page flickers as you scan. Limitation: a restrained accent system or neutral matting would greatly improve cohesion.

typography.explanation: Strong, editorial sans used consistently across hero, section titles, captions, and meta. Custom link treatment (black underline on light, white underline on dark) avoids default blue and keeps hierarchy clean. Clear scale: large hero/title, medium H2 'Projects'/'About', smaller caption/meta with consistent line-height and spacing. Rags are tidy and left-aligned; no widows/orphans visible. Limitation: the hero headline runs quite wide and heavy, making the block feel a bit dense; type voice is refined but not highly distinctive.

layout_composition.explanation: Crisp grid with consistent container width and even gutters. Hero uses a strong full-bleed image framed with equal lateral margins; headline and intro copy align cleanly beneath. 'Projects' section forms a disciplined 3‑column gallery: tiles share heights, gutters are even, and captions align uniformly below each image. The 'About' section switches to a dark background with a stable multi-column layout (photo left; Services/Clients/Locations/Press columns right) maintaining the same grid rhythm. Limitation: the 'Contact' button in the dark section feels slightly detached in its own block and the large value jump from white to black is abrupt, nudging rhythm continuity.

color.explanation: Minimal palette lets photography carry color; captions use a restrained grey on light and white on dark for readability. Link styling is consistent (underlined text matching the foreground color). Imagery across tiles feels harmonious without clashing. Limitation: neutrals appear close to pure #000/#fff with a hard value shift between sections and no visible hue‑tuned borders/shadows or a defined accent system, keeping it competent but not notably sophisticated.

typography.explanation: Clear hierarchy and system across many sections: 1) oversized, left‑aligned section titles (“Column”, “Webflow Brand”, etc.) in a bold grotesk create a consistent anchor; 2) a repeated meta row above each grid uses the same small sans style with consistent separators and spacing; 3) casing and weight rhythm is disciplined—titles in Title Case, meta in lighter weight; 4) hairline dividers and generous whitespace keep rhythm readable. No default blue link underlines in sight. Limitation: neutrals look close to pure black on white and link/state styling isn’t evident; the meta text runs quite small which may challenge readability.

layout_composition.explanation: A strong POV with a reliable grid: 1) two‑column structure puts huge headings/toggles on the left and dense thumbnail grids on the right; 2) identical gutters and tile sizes hold across long sections, with rows aligning cleanly; 3) section dividers and repeated S/M/L control affordances are placed consistently; 4) thumbnails are cropped uniformly with no cut‑offs or jagged edges visible. Limitation: a few sections show mixed aspect ratios and occasional ragged last rows, and the wrapped heading “Webflow Dot Com” slightly disturbs vertical alignment.

color.explanation: Minimal shell lets work carry color effectively: 1) black text on white with subtle grey dividers keeps focus on imagery; 2) the sticky‑note hero adds a single pop without overwhelming; 3) varied project tiles coexist without clashing due to consistent sizing. Limitations: neutrals appear untuned (#000 on #fff feel likely), and there’s no evident accent system or link state color; diverse tile backgrounds introduce minor value flicker the shell doesn’t actively unify.

typography.explanation: Readable, minimal type with a clear hierarchy: a modest H1 ('Shu Ding') followed by well‑spaced paragraphs; body measure sits around ~60–70ch with comfortable leading; sidebar items use a consistent italic style with a darker active state. Rags are clean and spacing between paragraphs is even. However, links appear to use a near‑default blue with the default underline thickness/offset, there’s little evidence of a tuned scale beyond one heading/body pair, and micro‑craft touches (custom underline, optical alignments, small‑label system) aren’t visible.

layout_composition.explanation: Simple two‑column layout with a fixed left navigation, a vertical divider, and a right content column shows solid alignment; the heading and first paragraph align neatly to the column edge; whitespace around the content block is generous and consistent. The sidebar items stack with regular spacing and the divider holds the structure together. Limitations: only a single basic view is shown, no complex grids or image handling to demonstrate orchestration, and the composition lacks a distinctive POV beyond the clean split.

color.explanation: Neutral palette is controlled: off‑white background, off‑black text, and a soft grey vertical rule provide calm contrast. Accent color is limited to links, keeping the page quiet. Yet the link hue/underline feels default and states aren’t demonstrated; there’s no visible unifying tinting or subtle border/shadow work that would elevate this to a more considered color system.

typography.explanation: Readable, conservative system sans with simple scale (nav, intro sentence, 'Featured work' heading). Body copy has a comfortable measure and line-height; rags are tidy. However, links use a bright default‑like blue with no visible hover/visited state, the typographic voice feels generic, and hierarchy relies on minimal size changes only. Casing and punctuation appear consistent but there’s little evidence of micro‑craft (no tuned underline weight/offset, no nuanced label system).

layout_composition.explanation: Straightforward single‑column layout with consistent container width and generous spacing between hero and work tiles. Project images align cleanly to the same left/right edges and are easy to scan. Weaknesses: the two tiles use different aspect ratios and heights, breaking vertical rhythm; one device mock is cropped at the bottom and the internal UI is too small to read; the overall structure follows a very standard 'centered intro + Featured work' pattern without a distinct POV.

color.explanation: Neutral white shell with black/near‑black text keeps content legible. Links are a strong default blue that reads as the only accent. Large project images introduce saturated blues/purples and cool greys; without mats or border tints to harmonize them, the section flickers slightly between dark and light backgrounds. No clear state system or tuned neutrals is visible.

typography.explanation: Clear hierarchy with restrained styles: section headers (Projects / Thoughts & ideas) use a heavier weight and tighter lead; titles are bold with smaller gray meta dates beneath, repeating consistently. Comfortable measures and even rhythm across all three columns; no widows/orphans visible. Links and CTAs are not default—titles read as links without default blue, and small arrows are used consistently for 'See all…' actions. Neutrals are tuned (off‑black body, soft gray meta), and casing is consistent. Limitation: link affordance relies on weight/color only (no underline), which could reduce clarity; a couple of excerpt lines run long, approaching an 80ch+ measure.

layout_composition.explanation: Disciplined three‑column grid with consistent gutters and vertical rhythm; item spacing within lists is uniform and aligns to a clear baseline. Headline 'Hello, I’m Rasmus' anchors the left column without crowding; right column balances with a concise bio and two compact card CTAs that match the grid width. The small vertical nav on the far right and the orange dot accent are aligned intentionally and do not break the layout. Limitation: the auxiliary right‑edge nav sits slightly off the main column grid, reading a bit floaty at this viewport.

color.explanation: Minimal, harmonious palette: off‑white background, off‑black text, soft gray for meta and cards, and a single bright orange dot as accent. The neutrals feel tuned—no harsh pure #000/#fff—and the side gutters in dark gray frame the content without stealing focus. Accents are sparse and role‑clear (orange dot/nav cue; subtle gray CTAs). Limitation: interactive link states aren’t evident in this view and title links share the same near‑black as body copy, reducing color‑based affordance.

typography.explanation: Mixed font system reduces cohesion: script/handwritten headings (e.g., 'My Work', 'Recommendations') paired with a plain sans body feel stylistically disconnected. Intro and testimonial paragraphs run long (roughly 85–95ch) which softens hierarchy and rhythm. Work tile captions are small white text over photography with low contrast, making them hard to read. Nav/link styling appears minimal and state logic isn’t evident. Section heading underlines and casual script vary in weight/spacing from body styles, adding inconsistency. Limitation: no clear link or hover treatment visible and some rags/measures read loose.

layout_composition.explanation: Overall structure is clear with sequential sections and adequate spacing. The 3‑tile 'My Work' row uses consistent tile sizes, corner radii, and even gutters. 'My Process' presents two cards with matched proportions and labels, and the contact section uses a two‑column split with an arched image. Roughness: the slider arrow in 'My Work' floats over the right tile creating a visual overlap; the testimonial block is a large rounded container with an inner rounded card and excessive negative space; vertical alignment between the left contact text and the arched photo feels off (baseline mismatch). Process images contain dense, unreadable text, weakening the information hierarchy within that section.

color.explanation: A cohesive warm beige palette with tinted section cards offers a consistent shell. Neutrals are soft and readable (dark grey on beige). However, the multiband background gradient introduces visual noise behind content. Photography varies in color temperature (wood desk, grey fabric, cool desktop, outdoor selfie) without neutral mats to unify them. White captions on photos lack contrast. Accents are restrained but state logic for links/buttons is not evident. Limitation: the busy gradient competes with content and slightly muddies hierarchy.

typography.explanation: Clear hierarchy: large display H1 with the name in italic adds emphasis, followed by a readable intro paragraph and consistent project titles/subheads. Body measure appears within ~60–70ch with comfortable leading, making long paragraphs easy to scan. Link/CTA styling is customized (accent-colored inline links and "Know more →" text links) with no default blue. Micro‑labels for project metadata (icons + small text) repeat consistently across cards. Limitations: casing treatment varies (all‑caps nav vs sentence‑case headings), some meta lines look small/light against the background, and link state behavior isn’t visible from this view.

layout_composition.explanation: Consistent left‑aligned column and content width across hero, project blocks, and footer creates strong rhythm. Project tiles use generous colored mats with orderly captions and stats below; offsets and gutters feel measured and repeat. The "Designing for Impact" mosaic shows controlled variation—tiles of different sizes still align to a grid with even gutters and stable baselines. The two‑column dark "About" section mirrors the grid and maintains clear focal points. Limitations: one project area renders as a solid black video/frame that interrupts the visual rhythm, and the floating avatar near the hero feels a bit detached from the column system.

color.explanation: Warm off‑white base with a coral/orange accent provides a distinct, coherent voice. Colored mats (muted lavender, soft green, deep navy) unify diverse screenshots without clashing; accents reinforce key words and CTAs. The dark section uses a near‑black background with cream text that still harmonizes with the warm palette. Limitations: the pure black video tile is a value outlier that breaks the otherwise controlled palette, and a secondary link hue (purple in the hero) suggests slight accent sprawl.

typography.explanation: Clear, disciplined type system across hero, card titles, meta lines, and body copy. Evidence: 1) Large display headline paired with medium-weight card titles and smaller meta lines using consistent scale steps; 2) Comfortable measures and leading in the right-column bio and case descriptions (~60–70ch, ~1.5 leading) with tidy rags and no widows; 3) Repeated meta style with dot separators and consistent casing/punctuation (e.g., “· 2024”), plus uniform uppercase pill tags for SHIPPED/CASE STUDY; 4) Active nav chip has a customized typographic treatment (rounded pill) matching the overall voice. Limitation: Link and click targets aren’t visually differentiated (project titles read like plain text), and the blurred first line in the hero slightly compromises readability.

layout_composition.explanation: Strong, cohesive grid and rhythm. Evidence: 1) Consistent three-column card grid with even gutters and aligned edges; 2) Identical card shells (matching corner radii and internal padding) keep varied imagery cohesive; 3) Hero uses a confident two-column composition (large left headline balanced with a right info panel) with clear vertical rhythm; 4) Captions and meta blocks sit at consistent offsets below each card, avoiding ragged bottoms. Limitation: Some internal screenshots are small within the colored mats and a couple of device frames feel busy, slightly reducing clarity at a glance.

color.explanation: Harmonious palette with tuned neutrals and disciplined accents. Evidence: 1) Off-white page background and off-black text avoid harsh #000/#fff; 2) Card mats use a controlled range of muted hues (lavender, pine, mustard, pink, slate) that harmonize and unify diverse screenshots; 3) Neutral grey/black chips and nav pill provide consistent accent logic without competing with project imagery; 4) Footer inversion (black background, white icons) is value-balanced and restrained. Limitation: A few mats (e.g., stronger mustard/green) run hot relative to neighbors, causing slight value flicker across rows.

typography.explanation: Readable sans system with a friendly rounded display for headings; hierarchy is clear from H1 to section labels. Buttons use customized pill styling rather than default links. Body copy in the About column has comfortable leading and short measure. Limitations: casing is inconsistent (e.g., 'Selected Work' vs 'Also a traveler!'); rags are a bit uneven in the hero and About paragraph; mixed micro‑labels ('Read More' vs 'Contact Me') and scattered punctuation reduce typographic discipline.

layout_composition.explanation: Single‑column structure with generous whitespace; repeated wide tiles share matching corner radii and a consistent shadow/mat; About section balances photo left with text right and a tidy experience list beneath. Issues: case study screenshots are small/unreadable inside device‑like frames; CTAs float at different positions ('Read More' on some, 'Contact Me' on others) causing rhythm flicker; a 'Coming soon' placeholder card and a narrow About text column break polish; blurred background scenes behind tiles add visual noise and compete with content.

color.explanation: Neutral shell (soft white background, off‑black text) keeps color restrained; consistent black pill buttons create a simple accent; grayscale travel thumbnails reduce noise. Limitations: no clear secondary accent system beyond black; blurred tile backgrounds vary in hue/value creating slight flicker; the brightly colored 'Lange' product photo jumps against the otherwise muted palette and the heavy black buttons occasionally overpower surrounding type.

typography.explanation: Readable, restrained sans-serif system with a clear H1 (“I am Jiyoung”), small body copy, and lighter caption style. Hero paragraph sits at a comfortable measure (~55–65ch) with 1.4–1.6 leading. Captions repeat a small grey meta style under each tile. However, link/CTA styling is conservative and default‑leaning (small outline button 'More about me'; no visible hover/state logic). The hero uses a very templated 'I am [Name]' structure with generic copy, and type voice feels generic rather than bespoke. Minor contrast concern where pale grey captions sit on light backgrounds.

layout_composition.explanation: Structure is competent: a left‑copy/right‑graphic hero with ample negative space and a two‑column project grid with consistent gutters and repeated caption positions. Tiles are aligned and spacing feels on a regular rhythm. Limitations: image handling isn’t unified—mixed device frames and mats (dark UIs, grey‑matted monitor mock, flat white screens, perspective print spread) create rhythm and value flicker; row heights vary noticeably. The centered 'See projects' + down arrow between hero and grid reads as a stock module and the outline CTA floats slightly from the text block.

color.explanation: Pleasant dark‑green charcoal hero with off‑white text provides solid contrast. The shell otherwise stays neutral, letting project imagery carry color. Yet the portfolio tiles introduce inconsistent backgrounds (dark screenshots, pale grey mats, pure white spreads) without a unifying border/shadow system, producing visual flicker. Accent/color system for interactive elements is unclear (button is neutral; links/states not shown), and the dark hero transitions abruptly to light sections without a bridging device.

typography.explanation: Large all‑caps hero with generous tracking establishes a clear top level; small uppercase nav and subhead keep a consistent voice; project captions repeat a micro label + meta pattern (e.g., 'Sunflower' with year) and footer copy sits at a comfortable ~60–70ch with relaxed leading. Smart punctuation appears in 'Let’s chat!'. However, link styling is minimal/default‑leaning (plain text links in the footer without visible state), capitalization varies across labels ('xbox' vs 'UCLA Library'), and the hero all‑caps feels slightly over‑tracked. Overall readable and organized but not notably customized.

layout_composition.explanation: Clear one‑column structure: a centered hero followed by three consistently wide project tiles with captions aligned beneath; spacing rhythm between tiles is even and gutters feel measured; footer forms a tidy 2‑column block aligned to the main container. Images are crisp with no obvious cropping issues and the repeated card format is consistent. Limitations: the structure is very template‑simple with little evidence of advanced grid decisions; decorative bands (green pattern) interrupt the vertical rhythm; slight mismatch between left‑aligned labels and centered hero makes the overall system feel more assembled than orchestrated.

color.explanation: A distinctive palette ties the page together: rich burgundy hero with white type, a playful green patterned band, and project thumbnails using cohesive muted paper textures and earthy reds/greens that harmonize with the shell. Contrast is controlled and imagery sits comfortably on the white background without clashing. Minor issues: the green strip is visually hot and can compete with the hero, neutrals for body text read close to pure black, and link state colors aren’t defined.

typography.explanation: Readable sans‑serif system with a clear hierarchy: large H1, card titles, and smaller grey descriptions. Body copy in the hero sits around a comfortable ~55–65ch with adequate 1.4–1.6 leading. Card titles repeat predictably and are easy to scan. However, link styling in the hero appears close to default bright blue with a default underline, not integrated with the palette. Casing is mixed (Title Case like “Service Design for Lyft” vs sentence‑style elsewhere; “Case Study Coming Soon!” stands out) and there’s minor scale inconsistency between card titles and descriptions. Overall competent but generic without bespoke micro‑craft touches.

layout_composition.explanation: Two‑column card layout with consistent gutters and repeated card structure (image block above, title/description below). Corner radii and soft shadows are consistent across tiles, and spacing between rows appears even. The staggered columns create a simple rhythm without collisions. Limitations: center‑aligned hero shifts to a left‑weighted content section later (“Like what you see?”) without a clear grid rationale; tile heights vary notably which produces a masonry vibe and irregular baselines; mixed asset types (flat browser screenshots vs an angled phone render) introduce uneven visual weight.

color.explanation: Pastel mats behind screenshots (yellow, orange, lavender, mint, aqua, peach) are harmonious in saturation and help differentiate projects. The shell is neutral (white background, dark text) and shadows are soft, keeping focus on tiles. Constraints: the bright blue inline link in the hero feels off‑system next to the pastel accents; varied screenshot colors (strong purples/greens) cause some palette noise; neutrals read closer to pure #000/#fff than tuned greys, so the overall color system feels serviceable rather than refined.

typography.explanation: Clear, restrained hierarchy across sections: large display hero with comfortable leading, then a repeating pattern of small all‑caps client label, bold project title, and light meta line. Measures are comfortable (intro paragraph ~60–70ch) with stable spacing between blocks. Links appear customized and unobtrusive (e.g., 'See All Work' in a muted tone without default blue/underline; nav items are consistent). Neutrals are off‑black/blue‑gray rather than pure black. Limitations: limited evidence of link/hover states; mixed casing (‘Selected work’ vs Title Case project titles) and an emoji in the intro slightly dents polish.

layout_composition.explanation: Consistent single‑column grid with a stable container width from hero through project list. Repeated project sections are disciplined: identical image mats with matching corner radii, even vertical rhythm, and captions positioned with the same offsets. Image handling is considered—soft shadows and isometric compositions unify varied assets without crop errors. The 'See All Work' sits aligned to the right edge establishing a clear header row. Limitation: composition is conventional (centered hero + stacked tiles) and a few device renders feel slightly generic, keeping it from a 5.

color.explanation: Tuned neutrals throughout (soft off‑white background, deep navy text) create a calm shell. A controlled accent scheme—cool blue for headings/links and a single warm peach pill for 'Contact'—adds hierarchy without noise. Light blue‑gray image mats and consistent shadow values effectively unify screenshots with varying internal palettes. Limitations: the peach accent is visually isolated (appears only in the contact button) and interactive state colors are not demonstrated.

typography.explanation: Distinct editorial serif for project titles paired with a clean sans for body/meta creates a clear hierarchy; the same title style repeats across all project sections. Body copy sits at a comfortable measure (~55–70ch) with even, ~1.4–1.6 leading and tidy rags; no widows/orphans visible. Micro‑labels on the right (role/year/areas) repeat with consistent weight/size and spacing, reinforcing rhythm. Warm off‑black text on off‑white background shows tuned neutrals rather than pure #000/#fff. Limitation: link styling/states are not clearly differentiated and some light‑grey meta text is close to low‑contrast, slightly reducing clarity.

layout_composition.explanation: A disciplined two‑column system anchors each project: left column for title/summary, right column for meta/links, aligned consistently from section to section. Vertical rhythm is measured—generous section spacing and consistent container width keep scan predictable; project images fill the content column with matching margins. Hero uses considered asymmetry (calligraphic mark and circular motif) without breaking the grid, and the dark footer grid resolves the page with clear structure. Limitation: image treatments vary (e.g., angled collage for Airbase, very dark Blitz mock, mixed window/device frames) which weakens cohesion compared to a fully unified tile system.

color.explanation: Palette leans on tuned neutrals: warm off‑white background, off‑black type, and subtle beige textures that sit quietly behind the work. Color is carried mainly by the project imagery; despite varied hues (purples, blues, dark UIs), the neutral shell keeps the page harmonious. The dark navy/charcoal footer creates a deliberate value shift that still feels part of the system. Limitation: no clearly defined accent/CTA color system or visible states; a couple saturated gradients rely solely on the image without unifying mats/borders, which slightly reduces cohesion.
